name: DNP3 PROTOCOL [Disable Unsolicited Responses]
description: The DNP3 function code 15 (Disable Unsolicited) is used to stop a DNP3 server from sending unsolicited responses, which could prevent field devices from sending alarms and other critical events. This rule looks for the DISABLE_UNSOLICITED request id in bro_dnp3 events.
query: class=bro_dnp3 requestid=disable_unsolicited NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: DNP3 PROTOCOL [Unsolicited Response Storm]
description: The DNP3 function code 82 (Unsolicited Response) indicates communication initiated by the DNP3 server without a request packet. These response types are typically used to transmit alarms or other critical events. An attacker could craft network traffic to send large amounts of unsolicited responses to a DNP3 client. A very large number of unsolicited responses could create a denial of service condition on a control server or overwhelm control center operators and delay response to real problems. This rule looks for at least 5 unsolicited responses in a 10 second period as indicated by the UNSOLICTED_RESPONSE field in bro_dnp3 events.
query: class=bro_dnp3 response=unsolicited_response NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: DNP3 PROTOCOL [Authorized Cold Restart]
description: The cold restart function code in a DNP3 request packet forces a restart and power up self-tests. An attacker could use the cold restart function to cause DNP3 servers to be unavailable for short periods or repeatedly send the cold restart request to cause the server to reboot continuously. This rule relies on a list named $dnp3.clients in order to determine if this IP address is authorized to be interacting with a DNP3 server. This rule looks for the COLD_RESTART request id in bro_dnp3 events and check whether or not those come from IP's listed in the $dnp3.clients list.
query: class=bro_dnp3 requestid=cold_restart srcipv4=$dnp3.clients NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: DNP3 PROTOCOL [Unauthorized Cold Restart]
description: The cold restart function code in a DNP3 request packet forces a restart and power up self-tests. An attacker could use the cold restart function to cause DNP3 servers to be unavailable for short periods or repeatedly send the cold restart request to cause the server to reboot continuously. This rule relies on a list named $dnp3.clients in order to determine if this IP address is authorized to be interacting with a DNP3 server. This rule looks for the COLD_RESTART request id in bro_dnp3 events and check whether or not those come from IP's listed in the $dnp3.clients list.
query: class=bro_dnp3 requestid=cold_restart NOT srcipv4=$dnp3.clients NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: DNP3 PROTOCOL [Unauthorized Read Request]
description: Since DNP3 protocol does not provide authentication for the source of a request, anyone with network access to a DNP3 server can make READ requests to a PLC. Unauthorized READ requests could indicate an attacker performing reconnaissance before an attack, or an unaccounted DNP3 client on the network. This rule relies on a list named $dnp3.clients in order to determine if this IP address is authorized to be interacting with a DNP3 server. This rule looks for the READ request id in bro_dnp3 events and check whether or not those come from IP's listed in the $dnp3.clients list.
query: class=bro_dnp3 requestid=read NOT srcipv4=$dnp3.clients NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: DNP3 PROTOCOL [Unauthorized Write Request]
description: Since DNP3 protocol does not provide authentication for the source of a request, anyone with network access to a DNP3 server can make WRITE requests to a PLC. A WRITE request could change the configuration of the PLC, make the PLC inoperable, send requests to actuators to change the state of the process being controlled, or overwrite important information. This rule relies on a list named $dnp3.clients in order to determine if this IP address is authorized to be interacting with a DNP3 server. This rule looks for the WRITE request id in bro_dnp3 events and check whether or not those come from IP's listed in the $dnp3.clients list.
query: class=bro_dnp3 requestid=write NOT srcipv4=$dnp3.clients NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: DNP3 PROTOCOL [Unauthorized Miscellaneous Request]
description: Since DNP3 protocol does not provide authentication for the source of a request, anyone with network access to a DNP3 server can make requests to a PLC. This rule relies on a list named $dnp3.clients in order to determine if this IP address is authorized to be interacting with a DNP3 server. This rule looks for any requests other than the READ and WRITE request id's in bro_dnp3 events and check whether or not those come from IP's listed in the $dnp3.clients list.
query: class=bro_dnp3 has:requestid NOT requestid=[read,write] NOT srcipv4=$dnp3.clients NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: DNP3 PROTOCOL [Stop Application]
description: The DNP3 function code 12 is used to stop applications on the PLC. Since DNP3 does not include authentication information, an attacker could either spoof a valid client or use a rogue DNP3 client to request applications to stop on a PLC. This rule looks for the STOP_APPL request id in bro_dnp3 events.
query: class=bro_dnp3 requestid=stop_appl NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: DNP3 PROTOCOL [Warm Restart]
description: The DNP3 function code 0E causes a PLC to re-initialize its configuration and clears the events. The warm restart function could be used by an attacker to either deny availability to a system by causing restarts, or clear forensic evidence by clearing the events. This rule looks for the WARM_RESART request id in bro_dnp3 events.
query: class=bro_dnp3 requestid=warm_restart NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [ILLEGAL FUNCTION]
description: Modbus exception code 0x01 implies that the function code received in the query is not an allowable action for the slave. This may be because the function code is only applicable to newer devices, and was not implemented in the unit selected. It could also indicate that the slave is in the wrong state to process a request of this type, for example because it is unconfigured and is being asked to return register values. If a Poll Program Complete command was issued, this code indicates that no program function preceded it. This rule looks for the ILLEGAL_FUNCTION string in the exceptionmsg field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events.
query: (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=illegal_function) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service:modbus-illegal-function) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [ILLEGAL_DATA_ADDRESS]
description: Modbus exception code 0x02 states that the data address received in the query is not an allowable address for the slave. More specifically, the combination of reference number and transfer length is invalid. For a controller with 100 registers, a request with offset 96 and length 4 would succeed, a request with offset 96 and length 5 will generate exception 02. This rule looks for the ILLEGAL_DATA_ADDRESS string in the exceptionmsg field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events.
query: (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=illegal_data_address) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-illegal-data-address) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [ILLEGAL_DATA_VALUE]
description: Modbus exception code 0x03 states that a value contained in the query data field is not an allowable value for the slave. This indicates a fault in the structure of remainder of a complex request, such as that the implied length is incorrect. It specifically does NOT mean that a data item submitted for storage in a register has a value outside the expectation of the application program, since the MODBUS protocol is unaware of the significance of any particular value of any particular register. This rule looks for the ILLEGAL_DATA_VALUE string in the exceptionmsg field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events.
query: (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=illegal_data_value) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-illegal-data-value) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [SLAVE_DEVICE_FAILURE]
description: Modbus exception code 0x04 states that an unrecoverable error occurred while the slave was attempting to perform the requested action. This rule looks for the SLAVE_DEVICE_FAILURE string in the exceptionmsg field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events.
query: (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=slave_device_failure) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-slave-device-failure) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [ACKNOWLEDGE]
description: Modbus exception code 0x05 is for ACKKNOWLEDGE, a specialized use code in conjunction with programming commands. The slave has accepted the request and is processing it, but a long duration of time will be required to do so. This response is returned to prevent a timeout error from occurring in the master. The master can next issue a Poll Program Complete message to determine if processing is completed. This rule looks for the ACKNOWLEDGE string in the exceptionmsg field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events.
query: (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=acknowledge) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-acknowledge) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [SLAVE_DEVICE_BUSY]
description: Modbus exception code 0x06 is for SLAVE_DEVICE_BUSY, a specialized use code in conjunction with programming commands. The slave is engaged in processing a long-duration program command. The master should retransmit the message later when the slave is free. This rule looks for the SLAVE_DEVICE_BUSY string in the exceptionmsg field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events.
query: (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=slave_device_busy) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-slave-device-busy) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [MEMORY_PARITY_ERROR]
description: Modbus exception code 0x08 has specialized use in conjunction with function codes 20 and 21 and reference type 6, to indicate that the extended file area failed to pass a consistency check. The slave attempted to read extended memory or record file, but detected a parity error in memory. The master can retry the request, but service may be required on the slave device. This rule looks for the MEMORY_PARITY_ERROR string in the exceptionmsg field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events.
query: (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=memory_parity_error) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-memory-parity-error) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [GATEWAY_PATH_UNAVAILABLE]
description: Modbus exception code 0x0A has specialized use in conjunction with gateways, indicates that the gateway was unable to allocate an internal communication path from the input port to the output port for processing the request. Usually means the gateway is misconfigured or overloaded. This rule looks for the GATEWAY_PATH_UNAVAILABLE string in the exceptionmsg field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events.
query: (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=gateway_path_unavailable) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-gateway-path-unavailable) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [GATEWAY_TARGET_DEVICE_FAILED_TO_RESPOND]
description: Modbus exception code 0x0B has specialized use in conjunction with gateways, indicates that no response was obtained from the target device. Usually means that the device is not present on the network. This rule looks for the GATEWAY_TARGET_DEVICE_FAILED_TO_RESPOND string in the exceptionmsg field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events.
query: (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=gateway_target_device_failed_to_respond) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-gateway-target-device-failed-to-respond) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [READ COILS]
description: This function code is used to read from 1 to 2000 contiguous status of coils in a remote device. This rule looks for the READ_COILS string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=read_coils) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-coils) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=read_coils_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-coils-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [READ DISCRETE INPUTS]
description: This function code is used to read from 1 to 2000 contiguous status of discrete inputs in a remote device. This rule looks for the READ_DISCRETE_INPUTS string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=read_discrete_inputs) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-discrete-inputs) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=read_discrete_inputs_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-discrete-inputs-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [READ INPUT REGISTERS]
description: This function code is used to read from 1 to 125 contiguous input registers in a remote device. This rule looks for the READ_INPUT_REGISTERS string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=read_input_registers) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-input-registers) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=read_input_registers_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-input-registers-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [WRITE SINGLE COIL]
description: This function code is used to write a single output to either ON or OFF in a remote device. This rule looks for the WRITE_SINGLE_COIL string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=write_single_coil) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-single-coil) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=write_single_coil_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-single-coil-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [WRITE SINGLE REGISTER]
description: This function code is used to write a single holding register in a remote device. This rule looks for the WRITE_SINGLE_REGISTER string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=write_single_register) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-single-register) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=write_single_register_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-single-register-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [READ EXCEPTION STATUS]
description: This function code is used to read the contents of eight Exception Status outputs in a remote device. This rule looks for the READ_EXCEPTION_STATUS string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=read_exception_status) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-exception-status) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=read_exception_status_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-exception-status-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [DIAGNOSTICS]
description: MODBUS function code 08 provides a series of tests for checking the communication system between a client ( Master) device and a server ( Slave), or for checking various internal error conditions within a server. This rule looks for the DIAGNOSTICS string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=diagnostics) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-diagnostics) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=diagnostics_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-diagnostics-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [GET COMM EVENT COUNTER]
description: This function code is used to get a status word and an event count from the remote device's communication event counter. This rule looks for the GET_COMM_EVENT_COUNTER string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=get_comm_event_counter) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-get-comm-event-counter) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=get_comm_event_counter_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-get-comm-event-counter-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [GET COMM EVENT LOG]
description: This function code is used to get a status word, event count, message count, and a field of event bytes from the remote device. This rule looks for the GET_COMM_EVENT_LOG string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=get_comm_event_log) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-get-comm-event-log) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=get_comm_event_log_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-get-comm-event-log-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [WRITE MULTIPLE COILS]
description: This function code is used to force each coil in a sequence of coils to either ON or OFF in a remote device. This rule looks for the WRITE_MULTIPLE_COILS string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=write_multiple_coils) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-multiple-coils) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=write_multiple_coils_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-multiple-coils-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [WRITE MULTIPLE REGISTERS]
description: This function code is used to write a block of contiguous registers (1 to 123 registers) in a remote device. This rule looks for the WRITE_MULTIPLE_REGISTERS string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=write_multiple_registers) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-multiple-registers) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=write_multiple_registers_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-multiple-registers-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [REPORT SLAVE ID]
description: This function code is used to read the description of the type, the current status, and other information specific to a remote device. This rule looks for the REPORT_SLAVE_ID string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=report_slave_id) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-report-slave-id) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=report_slave_id_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-report-slave-id-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [READ FILE RECORD]
description: This function code is used to perform a file record read. All Request Data Lengths are provided in terms of number of bytes and all Record Lengths are provided in terms of registers. This rule looks for the READ_FILE_RECORD string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=read_file_record) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-file-record) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=read_file_record_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-file-record-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [WRITE FILE RECORD]
description: This function code is used to perform a file record write. All Request Data Lengths are provided in terms of number of bytes and all Record Lengths are provided in terms of the number of 16-bit words. This rule looks for the WRITE_FILE_RECORD string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=write_file_record) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-file-record) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=write_file_record_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-write-file-record-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [MASK WRITE REGISTER]
description: This function code is used to modify the contents of a specified holding register using a combination of an AND mask, an OR mask, and the register's current contents. The function can be used to set or clear individual bits in the register. This rule looks for the MASK_WRITE_REGISTER string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=mask_write_register) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-mask-write-register) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=mask_write_register_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-mask-write-register-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [READ WRITE MULTIPLE REGISTERS]
description: This function code performs a combination of one read operation and one write operation in a single MODBUS transaction. The write operation is performed before the read. This rule looks for the READ_WRITE_MULTIPLE_REGISTERS string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=read_write_multiple_registers) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-write-multiple-registers) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=read_write_multiple_registers_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-write-multiple-registers-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [READ FIFO QUEUE]
description: This function code allows to read the contents of a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) queue of register in a remote device. The function returns a count of the registers in the queue, followed by the queued data. Up to 32 registers can be read: the count, plus up to 31 queued data registers. The queue count register is returned first, followed by the queued data registers. This rule looks for the READ_FIFO_QUEUE string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=read_fifo_queue) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-fifo-queue) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=read_fifo_queue_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-read-fifo-queue-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: MODBUS PROTOCOL [ENCAP INTERFACE TRANSPORT]
description: The MODBUS Encapsulated Interface (MEI)Transport is a mechanism for tunneling service requests and method invocations, as well as their returns, inside MODBUS PDUs. This rule looks for the ENCAP_INTERFACE_TRANSPORT string in the method field in bro_modbus events and in the service field in paloalto_threat_vulnerability events. This rule also looks for exception messages of the same type.
query: (class=bro_modbus method=encap_interface_transport) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-encap-interface-transport) OR (class=bro_modbus exceptionmsg=encap_interface_transport_exception) OR (class=paloalto_threat_vulnerability service=modbus-encap-interface-transport-exception) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4
